Ad Text:
WHO WE ARE

AGITO are a multinational engineering company who develop and implement automation and technology solutions.

Our engineering expertise and industry knowledge are in the areas of logistics, distribution, production and materials handling. Systems engineering, manufacturing, software development, and ongoing service are an important part of our business model, and we encourage our team to seek out innovative and contemporary methods.

AGITO’s recent joint venture partnership with Hilton Food Group is a key driver for our growth and global expansion, and with the support of Hilton, we are advancing into new markets and transforming the automation sector.

This position offers the right person an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a business that will only continue to grow.




PURPOSE OF ROLE

The core functions of the role are designing and developing software solutions for AGITO’s automation solutions and will also include support for systems already in the field.

You will be at the forefront of designing and developing software for technologies in the areas of automation (AMRs, Roaming Shuttle systems, Co-bots, etc) and real-time communications as we expand into new markets across the globe.




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

The role will give the successful applicant the opportunity to:

Build efficient and reusable applications and services that improve usability and remote support for AGITO Automation solutions

Develop data analysis and reporting functionality

Develop tools and dashboards for Materials Handling and Warehousing systems

Design and develop to API specifications

Develop innovative networking and communications solutions with a focus on cyber security, scalability, and performance

Work with mechanical and electrical teams on integration of IT Systems with mechatronic / robotic systems

Participate in code reviews with other engineers

Set up server hardware, switches, virtualizing platforms and cloud environments

Be part of the commissioning, installation and connection of developed systems on customer’s site

Communicate and demonstrate the software and AGITO’s vision clearly to customers and external customers

Software support, service and maintenance




KEY EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Experience:

Hold a Tertiary Qualification in Computer Science, IT, Software Engineering, or a related discipline

Have a minimum 5+ years’ experience in Software Development

Have solid programming skills demonstrating advanced knowledge of building APIs using modern OO languages such as C#, .Net, Node.js, JAVA, JavaScript, HTML5, XML, JSON, SQL, NoSQL

Practical experience with automation systems is mandatory

Hands on experience implementing solutions on both Linux and Windows platforms

Work collaboratively and be committed to be part of a successful team

Adapt to new programming frameworks and languages as required

Respond quickly to client demands

Have experience in software support, service and maintenance covering multiple external clients / customers.




Knowledge & Skills:

A willingness to learn and grow your knowledge

The knowledge and experience to adapt to new programming frameworks and languages as required

The drive to respond quickly to client demands

Be able to effectively communicate at all levels within the business and our customers

Attention to detail and delivery of quality outcomes

Be able to effectively troubleshoot issues down to root cause and develop corrective actions

Experience in design and development to API “best practice design” and specifications

The ability to work either as part of a team or autonomously and prioritise competing demands

Have solid skills in documenting solutions and manuals

Ability to review, understand, document and improve existing code / solutions




AT AGITO

We are all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.

We work hard to support and nurture our people, and as the business continues to expand into international markets, we offer ongoing career development and opportunities for our team.

Please note:

To apply you must reside in AU & hold Permanent working rights.

This role will initially be 100% WFH, transitioning to Hybrid.

Senior Data Engineer - AWS/Azure & Databricks

Your new company

You'll be joining a large, forward‑thinking organisation that is expanding its data and AI capabilities to support long‑term growth. The business is building a modern data environment designed to deliver trusted, reusable datasets that support analytics, automation, and machine‑learning initiatives across multiple teams.
The environment is complex and fast‑moving, with close collaboration across various technology and business functions. The company values adaptability, continuous improvement, and a strong customer focus. As the organisation evolves, new opportunities emerge, offering the chance to shape how data and AI are used across the enterprise.



Your new role

As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in delivering the organisation's AI and data strategy. Reporting to the data engineering leadership team, you'll design and build pipelines, frameworks, and processes that transform foundational data assets into high‑value, derived data products.


Engineering

Execute the data and AI product roadmap and contribute to strategic delivery.

Build high‑quality ETL/ELT and MLOps pipelines that support a single source of truth and reusable data products.

Write, maintain, and review clean, high‑quality source code.

Develop and support a high‑performing data engineering and machine‑learning operations platform.

Identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities and best practices.

Partner with infrastructure teams to ensure seamless end‑to‑end delivery of data and AI services.

Troubleshoot and resolve issues across data pipelines and platforms.

Support BAU data products and platforms in line with agreed service levels.

Collaboration

Work within agile ways of working and contribute to sprint delivery.

Share knowledge across engineering and IT teams to promote reusable data assets.

Support governance and risk teams to ensure responsible data management.

Partner with a wide range of stakeholders including data engineers, ML engineers, data scientists, analysts, business partners, DevOps engineers, project managers, and testers.

Contribute to the broader Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence and help foster a great team culture.


What you'll need to succeed

Experience working in large or complex organisations.

A degree in a technical or quantitative field, or equivalent experience.

5+ years of hands‑on data engineering or MLOps experience.

Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python.

Experience with ETL/ELT, MLOps, dimensional modelling, feature engineering, and modern data architectures.

Exposure to AI‑related tooling, platforms, or concepts.

Experience with at least one major cloud provider.

Familiarity with modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Databricks, Airflow, cloud data warehouses).

Bonus: experience with software engineering or DevOps practices.

A problem‑solving mindset, curiosity, and comfort working in ambiguity.

A proactive, positive attitude.


What you'll get in return

The opportunity to work on meaningful, high‑impact data and AI initiatives that shape how the organisation operates.

A modern technology environment with access to contemporary tools, platforms, and engineering practices.

Support from a collaborative team that values learning, experimentation, and continuous improvement.

Exposure to a wide range of stakeholders across technology and the business, giving you strong visibility and influence.

Professional development opportunities, including training, certifications, and the chance to broaden your skills across data engineering, MLOps, and AI.

A culture that encourages innovation, ownership, and creative problem‑solving.

Flexibility, stability, and the ability to grow your career in a supportive environment.


What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job Title: Senior Data Engineer - Sydney or Melbourne
Ad Text:
Our ‘black belt’ specialists are leaders in their domains: platform and cloud champions, delivery-focused engineers, security-first practitioners, AI thought leaders, and advocates for engineering best practice.

With a global presence and strong local expertise, we deliver modern, resilient platforms without compromising on quality. Our multidisciplinary teams solve complex problems at scale, embedding reliability, security, and operational excellence through our most senior technologists.

Empower Your Career with Us

Are you ready to join a dynamic team that empowers businesses through robust engineering capabilities? We seek talented individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment with a strong sense of urgency and a focus on execution.

Position Overview

We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join our team on a major engagement with a tier-one financial services organisation. You will play a critical role in building data products, enabling Microsoft Fabric integration, and delivering insights through dashboards and supplier reporting.

Your data products will feed into new agent-based automation and generative AI initiatives, making this an opportunity to work on some of the most exciting emerging technologies in enterprise data.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and optimise data products to support dashboards, reporting, and automation.
Deliver high-quality, scalable data pipelines leveraging dbt and AWS.
Apply data quality and governance frameworks to ensure accuracy, reliability, and compliance.
Collaborate with product owners, and stakeholders to translate requirements into robust technical solutions.
Contribute to workflow automation and data completeness improvements.
Document solutions clearly and maintain best practices across engineering delivery.

Experience

Strong SQL engineering skills with proven experience building and optimising data pipelines in enterprise environments.
Exposure to dbt, Python and AWS stack.
Familiarity with data modelling, reporting layers, and dashboard integration.
Understanding of data quality frameworks, lineage, and governance practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in fast-paced, Agile delivery environments.

What We Offer

A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and career progression.
Competitive compensation.
The chance to work on one of the largest data transformation programs in Australia, with exposure to AI-powered solutions shaping the future of financial services.

If you are ready to lead platform engineering at scale and make a tangible impact on how modern software is built and delivered, we would love to hear from you.

Contract Data Engineer – Workday Migration

Location: Melbourne (Hybrid)
Contract: 6 Months

We're looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team on a 6-month contract and play a key role in a major migration project, from TechnologyOne to Workday (Finance and HR systems).

This is a fantastic opportunity to work on a high-impact project, leveraging your expertise in data migration and the Microsoft data stack to deliver a seamless transition.

What You'll Do

Lead and execute data migration activities from TechnologyOne to Workday.

Design and implement robust ETL pipelines for data extraction, transformation, and loading.

Ensure data integrity, quality, and compliance throughout the migration process.

Collaborate with Finance, HR, and IT teams to align technical solutions with business needs.

Optimize performance and scalability of data solutions using modern tools.

What We're Looking For

Proven experience migrating systems to Workday (Finance and HR modules).

Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft data stack, including:

Azure Data Factory

Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse/Warehouse, Pipelines, Notebooks)

SQL Server, PySpark, and data modelling.

Solid understanding of data governance, security, and compliance.

Ability to work independently and communicate effectively with stakeholders.

Based in Melbourne with availability for hybrid work.

Australian work rights are required for this contract position.


Sound interesting? Apply now and be part of a project that makes a real impact. For a confidential discussion, reach out today, we’d love to hear from you!

Role Overview
We are seeking a Cloud Engineer with strong hands-on experience in AWS or Azure to support the design, build and operation of enterprise-scale cloud environments. This role will be heavily involved in large cloud migration initiatives and ongoing platform operations, with a strong focus on security, networking and reliability.

Key Responsibilities
Design, build and operate cloud infrastructure in AWS or Azure across multiple environments
Support and deliver large-scale cloud migration projects (on-prem to cloud and hybrid)
Implement and maintain cloud security best practices, including identity, network security and monitoring
Work closely with application, security and network teams to deliver robust cloud solutions
Troubleshoot and resolve complex cloud infrastructure and networking issues
Required Experience & Skills
Minimum 5 years hands-on cloud experience (AWS or Azure) across design, build and operations
Strong experience with core cloud services and architectures in your chosen platform
Broad cloud security knowledge, including identity and access management, encryption and network security
Networking fundamentals advantageous (TCP/IP, DNS, routing, firewalls, VPNs, load balancing)
Proven experience working on large cloud migration programs
Desirable
Infrastructure as Code experience (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation, Bicep, ARM)
CI/CD and automation experience
Relevant cloud certifications (AWS or Azure)

If this sounds like you, please apply within or send your updated cv to chris.selvage@mtr.com.au

Join a fast-growing tech team developing cutting-edge software for smart manufacturing! Enjoy flexibility, innovation, and competitive rewards.

Our client is a leader in next-generation, smart composite materials and is at the forefront of innovation in the manufacturing sector. As they experience rapid expansion, they are looking for a Control Systems Engineer to join their dynamic team in Altona North, Melbourne, Victoria.


Position Overview:
Control Systems Engineer to contribute to the development of innovative processing equipment. The Control Systems Engineer will play a pivotal role in the development and design of automated processes.
 

Key Responsibilities:


Develop the process automation/control systems (including communication networks) hardware architecture - typically comprising of PLCs, safety controllers, functional safety field devices, variable speed drives, power generation and chemical (gas) processing equipment.
In conjunction with process specialists, design control schemes for new material processing lines, then build, test and operate these systems.
Assist in the development of new capabilities for control system design, testing, certification and production.
Develop, program and implement control systems and control strategies for process manufacturing applications, simulating and testing to ensuring stability and reliability.
Develop and maintain system documentation including functional specifications, design specifications, test plans, and operational manuals.
Provide technical support to development and operational teams during system development, commissioning, deployment and production.
Participate in the engineering peer group and exchange of ideas and feedback within the team.
Ensure all regulatory and safety requirements are met.
Stay up to date with the latest control systems technologies and industry trends.
Train staff in control systems functionality and troubleshooting.
Ensure the safety of all activities, including safety procedures and risk assessments for development and production activities.
Assist with submissions to all relevant certification authorities for approvals.
Establish systems and procedures for management of control system design data, in collaboration with control system engineers at other sites.
Assist in continually improving the output of the team.
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Electrical /Automation/Control Systems Engineering or equivalent.

Desirable:

Post-graduate degree or advanced qualifications in Control Systems, Industrial Control, Electrical, Mechatronics or Renewable Energy.
Experience with artificial intelligence / machine learning for intelligent control.
Experience in the new energy industry, manufacturing or research & development.
Functional Safety qualifications (i.e. TUV Certified Engineer).
At least 3 years of automation/control systems engineering experience within a mining or industrial setting.

If you are interested in this role, please send in an updated CV by Clicking the APPLY NOW Button.
Join a fast-growing team developing cutting-edge software for smart manufacturing! Enjoy flexibility, innovation, and competitive rewards.

AI Platform Engineer (6 Month Contract)

Join a growing proptech company building next-generation AI platforms that power intelligent, data-driven property products. You’ll play a key role designing and scaling secure, cost-efficient LLM and agent-based systems used in real-world production environments.

The Role
You’ll work hands-on across AI platform architecture, agent frameworks, and LLM optimisation, partnering closely with product and engineering teams to deliver reliable, production-grade AI capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement multi-agent RAG applications for complex, real-world workflows.
Improve agent caching strategies to enhance performance and reduce latency.
Optimise LLM cost, throughput, and response quality across production systems.
Implement security controls within agent architectures (permissions, data access, guardrails).
Apply grounding and factuality-checking techniques to reduce hallucinations and improve trust.
Monitor, evaluate, and continuously improve AI platform performance in production.
Skills & Experience

Strong experience building LLM-powered applications in production.
Hands-on with RAG architectures, agent frameworks, and orchestration patterns.
Proven experience optimising LLM cost, token usage, and inference efficiency.
Solid understanding of AI security, data access controls, and safe AI design.
Experience with grounding techniques (retrieval validation, citations, factuality checks).
Strong engineering background (Python preferred; cloud-native experience highly valued).
Why Join

Work on real production AI systems, not demos.
Influence platform architecture from an early stage.
Join a fast-scaling proptech with strong product-market traction.
Competitive salary, flexible work, and real ownership.
If you’re excited by building scalable, trustworthy AI platforms that solve real problems, we’d love to hear from you.

Data Scientist | AI & Advanced Analytics | Perth

Your new company

A leading organisation in the mining sector is seeking a Data Scientist to join their analytics team. This role focussesz on delivering innovative AI and machine learning solutions to drive operational efficiency and business insights.

Competitive daily rate

What you need to do now

GRIT is hiring on behalf of our client in the AEC sector for a skilled Machine Learning Engineer with strong Python expertise and experience delivering within larger, cross-functional teams. In this role, you’ll play a key part in designing, developing, and deploying ML models and AI-driven solutions on Azure, collaborating closely with BAs, developers, and data professionals to support innovation across the built environment.

What You’ll Do

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production environments
Collaborate with analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders to transform prototypes into scalable solutions
Enhance MLOps pipelines and ensure performance, reliability, and accuracy
Leverage Azure ML, AI Search, OpenAI and cloud-based data services
Monitor, update and maintain ML models to ensure optimal performance
What you’ll bring:
1+ year of commercial experience in machine learning and Python
Solid grasp of tools like scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, Plotly
Experience working in production environments with Git and cloud (Azure preferred)
Proficiency in Python (using VSCode or PyCharm)
Strong problem-solving, time management, and communication skills
A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or related field
Azure ML experience or certification highly desirable
Highly Desirable:
Knowledge of MLOps (MLFlow, Optuna), REST APIs (FastAPI, Flask), and Linux
Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow
Familiarity with 3D geometry or IFC/IfcOpenShell
This is a fast moving role! Reach out to TJ Tan on +61489279874 or tj@grittalent.com for a confidential discussion.

At Intelligen, we’re building something different. Over the past three years, we’ve evolved from a bold startup to a trusted partner for some of Australia’s most complex data transformations. We’ve helped organisations move from legacy to modern platforms, embedded governance into decision-making, and brought AI into the hands of the business - responsibly and at speed.

But we’re just getting started. As we move into our next phase of growth, we’re looking for consultants who don’t just want to deliver great solutions - but help shape the future of data and AI capability across Australia.

We’re looking for a Data Engineer, based in Sydney, who can design and deliver modern, scalable data solutions across multi-cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) and modern data stacks, primarily using Databricks.

You’ll work directly with clients to understand their data challenges, architect and build high-quality pipelines, and support analytics, governance, and AI enablement initiatives. This role blends hands-on engineering with consulting - helping clients realise value at pace while contributing to Intelligen’s growing engineering capability.

This role is ideal for someone who loves solving complex engineering problems, thrives in modern data ecosystems, and wants to work in a high-performing team doing meaningful, future-shaping work.

Design, build, and optimise scalable Databricks Lakehouse solutions across AWS, Azure, and GCP
Develop robust data ingestion, transformation, and orchestration pipelines using Databricks (Spark, Delta Lake, Workflows)
Build high-quality data models to support analytics, reporting, and AI/ML use cases
Implement medallion architectures (bronze, silver, gold) and modern data engineering patterns
Collaborate closely with clients to translate business requirements into well-architected, actionable data solutions
Support or implement dbt, CI/CD pipelines, Git-based workflows, and engineering best practices
Ensure strong data quality, governance, lineage, security, and performance optimisation within Databricks environments.
Work alongside analytics, governance, and AI consultants to deliver cohesive, end-to-end solutions
Contribute to reusable assets, accelerators, and internal frameworks that strengthen Intelligen’s Databricks capability
Mentor junior engineers and positively influence client delivery and engineering standards




Requirements



4–6+ years’ experience in data engineering or analytics engineering
Strong hands-on experience with Databricks (Spark, Delta Lake, Workflows), ideally in production environments
Experience with at least one major cloud platform: AWS, Azure, or GCP
Strong SQL skills and experience building complex data transformations
Familiarity with modern data stacks — e.g. Databricks, Snowflake, dbt, cloud data lakes, orchestration tools
Experience working across the full data lifecycle: ingestion → transformation → modelling → consumption
Consulting, stakeholder-facing experience, or cross-functional delivery exposure
Knowledge of DevOps concepts, version control, and/or CI/CD in data environments
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and collaboration skills
Sydney-based, with ability to work on-site with clients as required
A mindset of curiosity, delivery excellence, and continuous learning




Benefits



We’re not just delivering AI and data projects, we’re humanising them. That means we care deeply about the how, not just the what. We value curiosity, creativity, and a willingness to challenge the status quo. We look for people who are driven to build a business, get curious, and offer up their opinions and ideas.

As well as:

Work From Home - Flexible hours
Training & Development
Free Food & Snacks
Many socials and community groups
Opportunity to drive projects that are of interest to you!

You’ll work with a team that’s smart, kind, and ambitious. You’ll have real influence in your projects, your practice, and our business. And as we grow, so will you.

Job Title: AI Architect / Principal Engineer - Contract or Perm
Ad Text:
Our 'black belt' specialists are leaders in their domains: digital champions, delivery-focused experts, top-tier security professionals, AI thought leaders, and engineering best practice advocates.

With a global presence and local expertise, we deliver innovative solutions without compromising on quality. Our multidisciplinary teams provide tailored expertise to solve complex problems at scale, ensuring engineering excellence through our top technologists.

Empower Your Career with Us

Are you ready to join a dynamic team that empowers businesses through robust engineering capabilities? We seek talented individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment with a strong sense of urgency and a focus on execution.

Overview of the Role

We are seeking an experienced AI Architect / Principal Engineer to help shape and drive our AI strategy and product innovation. This role bridges the gap between ambitious business objectives and pragmatic technical implementation. You will work closely with product teams not only to architect AI-powered solutions but to ensure they are commercially viable, secure, and built for scale. The ideal candidate combines deep technical knowledge of AI/ML with the practical experience of an enterprise architect who understands the importance of cost management, security posture, and operational excellence.

Candidates must have a minimum of 2-3 years of AI/ML experience to be considered for this Solutions Architect role.

A minimum of 5-6 years of architecture experience is required for this position.

A Bachelor's degree is required for this role.

Australian work rights are required for this position.

Key Responsibilities

Lead AI Product Strategy & Discovery: Lead workshops to identify high-impact opportunities for AI integration, translating business requirements into technical solutions that drive tangible value.
Scalable Architecture Strategy: Develop a product and technology strategy fit for purpose, ensuring architectures are designed to meet the rigorous scalability demands of our platform (latency, throughput, and high availability).
Security & Compliance: Architect solutions that strictly adhere to enterprise security requirements, designing safeguards against data leakage, prompt injection, and ensuring compliance with data privacy standards.
Cost Management & Optimization: Design architectures with strict cost constraints in mind. Optimize token usage, model selection, and infrastructure to ensure the solution is commercially viable and maintains healthy margins.
Financial Responsibility: Drive a financially responsible AI strategy that balances innovation with fiscal discipline, ensuring projects deliver key business outcomes while achieving specific financial targets (ROI and Total Cost of Ownership).
Operational Excellence: Guide the operationalisation of AI solutions, ensuring they are maintainable, observable, and performant in a production environment.
Technical Leadership: Collaborate with product teams to define AI feature roadmaps, creating detailed technical specifications and providing guidance on integration best practices.
Technology Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend AI technologies, frameworks, and platforms, balancing "bleeding edge" capabilities with enterprise stability.

Skills and Experience

Required:

AI Product Implementation: Proven experience developing and implementing customer-facing AI/ML products, particularly those utilizing LLMs, in a production environment.
LLM Experience: Candidates must have experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) for this AI Solutions Architect position.
Enterprise Architecture: Extensive experience in solution architecture with a focus on non-functional requirements—specifically scalability, performance, and reliability in distributed systems.
Financial & Cost Management (FinOps): Demonstrated ability to manage the economics of AI. Experience calculating unit economics, managing API/Token costs, and optimizing cloud infrastructure spend.
Security First Mindset: Strong understanding of AI security risks and experience implementing secure data handling practices within regulated or enterprise environments.
Strategic Execution: Strong track record of creating and executing enterprise-wide AI strategies that align technical output with business goals.
Communication: Demonstrated ability to translate complex technical concepts (and their associated costs/risks) to non-technical stakeholders and executive leadership.
Operational Scale: Strong understanding of MLOps, CI/CD for AI, and the requirements for running AI workloads at scale.

Preferred:

Experience with publicly deployed LLM-based products.
Experience at training LLMs.
Background in product monetisation and revenue optimisation.
Experience with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their specific AI suites.
Understanding of AI ethics and governance.
Experience in agile development environments.

This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of our product offering through innovative AI solutions. The successful candidate will be both a strategic thinker and a hands-on implementer, capable of taking AI initiatives from concept to reality while ensuring they make financial and operational sense.

Overview

Developers are working hard to build our new reality, and the Azure Experience & Ecosystems Engineering team is here to help. The team's product, Microsoft Learn, offers learning paths, content, and interactive experiences that help people develop the skills that in-demand jobs require. As such, we contribute directly to Microsoft's mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

As a Software Engineer II in Azure Experience & Ecosystems Engineering team, you will build the Microsoft Learn product which will positively impact how people experience Microsoft's technology. You will be responsible for building Content and Learning experiences through constant innovation, design, and implementing state-of-the-art systems. This opportunity will allow you to learn from unique engineering challenges in AI, frontend and backend services and leverage AI to shape Microsoft Learn into a trusted, personalized knowledge platform that meets developers where they are.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Works with product management, design and data analyst teams to determine user requirements for a set of features.

Contributes to the identification of dependencies, and the development of design documents for a product area with little oversight.

Creates and implements code for a product, service, or feature, reusing code as applicable.

Contributes to efforts to break down larger work items into smaller work items and provides estimation.

Acts as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) working on-call to monitor system/product feature/service for degradation, downtime, or interruptions and gains approval to restore system/product/service for simple problems.

Remains current in skills by investing time and effort into staying abreast of current developments that will improve the availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and performance of products while also driving consistency in monitoring and operations at scale.

Qualifications
Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 2+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. 

2+ years of professional experience in cloud service development using one or more of these technologies: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), JavaScript, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), .NET, Node.js, Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interfaces (REST APIs).

1+ year(s) of demonstrated problem-solving, design, and debugging skills, with a passion for quality, performance, and engineering excellence.

Other Requirements: 

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. 

Preferred Qualifications:  

Experience with cloud-native architecture, microservices, and asynchronous workflows. 

Experience with agent-based systems, workflow engines, or declarative programming models is highly desirable.

Experience with AI-assisted coding tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot) and large language models (LLMs) such as GPT or Claude Sonnet.

Experience collaborating closely with product and design to shape abstractions and reference implementations that scale across use cases.

#azurecorejobs

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Who We Are

 

iSelect and Compare the Market are trusted, well-known brands dedicated to helping millions of Australians compare and buy personal finance and household products such as insurance, energy, and loans. Together, we provide a seamless, customer-focused experience that makes it easier for Australians to find the right products to suit their needs.

 

 

What You’ll Be Doing 

 

As an AI Engineer, you will provide technical leadership and expertise, driving the design, development, and delivery of innovative AI solutions for the Aggregation business. 

You will ensure technical excellence through modern AI development practices, data driven thinking, strategic technology use, and alignment with business goals. This role actively contributes to architectural decisions, promotes best practices, and supports a culture of continuous innovation with the business. As well as:

Own AI feature delivery: work from discovery to production; define technical approaches, identify clear entry and exit points, and assist with rollout plans for new AI capabilities.
Build with AI: design prompts; orchestrate LLMs; implement retrieval augmented generation and memory; integrate with model context protocol; ensure observability; support evaluations; build a repeatable AI delivery lifecycle.
Lay a solid foundation: influence key decisions on the future of AI in the Aggregation Business; establish AI engineering standards (prompt patterns, guardrails, observability, evaluation, cost optimisation); DevOps for AI artefacts; document decisions and trade-offs; ensure alignment with company AI policies
Mentor and multiply: coach engineers on AI and productionising AI solutions.
Partner with product, data and engineering teams:  translate customer needs into measurable AI outcomes; instrument usage, quality, reliability; iterate based on data.

                                                                                                                                      

 

What’s In It For You

 

At Compare the Market and iSelect, we’re all about helping people make smart choices – and joining us might just be yours.  We offer an environment where your ideas are heard, your contributions are valued, and your growth genuinely matters. Collaboration is part of our DNA, and you’ll be joining a supportive, forward-thinking team where you can do meaningful work (and be recognised for it!) 

 

We’re guided by three shared values that shape how we work, how we treat each other, and how we show up for our customers - Drive, Noble Intent and All Together.

 

Plus, we offer a range of great perks to help you thrive both in and out of work:

 

Vibrant and social community who have annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events
Enjoy flexible work arrangements, including the option of one day working from home each week or a 9-day fortnight
Enjoy additional leave days - ‘ME’ leave and ‘Volunteer Day’ leave
Option to purchase additional leave
Return To Work bonus for returning parents
Quarterly Award and Recognition program

 

What Sets You Apart 

5+ years of experience in full-stack environments.
Hands-on experience taking AI features to production under real world constraints: scale, latency, cost and regulatory risk.
Demonstrated expertise in system design and integration, including foundation model selection, agentic framework choice, multi-modal input handling (structured data, text, and speech), RAG pipelines (chunking, embeddings, vector stores), and MCP.
Proficiency in Python essential.  Proficiency in other languages (Typescript/JavaScript, C#, Java, SQL) desirable
Experience with AWS Cloud (including Bedrock), Databricks, Kubernetes, serverless, event-driven architectures.
Proficient in modern DevOps practices, observability, and end-to-end software development essential.
Curiosity and willingness to adapt in a fast-moving field essential



 

At Compare the Market and iSelect we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we embrace diversity.  

 

This role is available to candidates with unlimited Australian working rights only. Sponsorship is not available.  

 

Compare the Market and iSelect are committed to protecting your privacy. All applications and personal information are kept confidential and securely stored in line with Australian privacy laws, used only for recruitment purposes, and not shared with third parties outside the Auto and General Holdings Group without your consent.

Job Title: Software Engineer - Assembly, Integration and Verification (AIV)
Category:
Engineering - Software (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Salary: AU$118K - AU$127K per annum + upto 15.4% super
Ad Text:
Job description:

Acknowledgement of Country

CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.

Role highlights

Great opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge telescope technology
Apply your software engineering expertise in a global science project
Join a collaborative team shaping the future of radio astronomy!

About CSIRO

As Australia's national science agency, CSIRO is solving the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. Many of our iconic innovations were once considered impossible until someone, just like you, joined us and took on the challenge.

Visit CSIRO.au for more information.

The opportunity

The SKA Observatory (SKAO) is a next-generation radio astronomy facility that will transform our understanding of the Universe and fundamental physics. Our CSIRO Assembly, Integration and Verification (AIV) team plays a critical role in integrating complex digital and RF systems into the SKA-Low Telescope (located in remote WA) signal chain and verifying the telescope against defined requirements. This team works closely with international partners to deliver one of the world's most advanced scientific instruments.

As a Software Engineer joining our dynamic AIV team, you will provide software support services for the SKA-Low telescope, focusing on the integration and verification of distributed software systems and associated hardware. Your work will include deploying solutions on high-performance computing (HPC) platforms, integrating data processing workflows, and supporting telescope operations during construction. This role offers the chance to work in an agile, globally distributed team environment.

You will bring strong experience in Python development and a solid background in deploying and supporting distributed software systems on HPC or cloud platforms. Familiarity with Linux environments and container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes will be highly regarded. Your ability to solve complex problems, collaborate effectively across time zones, and adapt to evolving project needs will be key to success.

If you're passionate about software engineering and excited by the opportunity to contribute to a globally significant science project, this is a great opportunity to apply your skills and grow your career - so we would love to hear from you!

Your high-level duties will include:
Proactively identifying, investigating, and solving complex problems spanning multiple software and hardware components, as part of a multi-disciplinary, regionally dispersed team.
Integrating control and data processing software components in a self-managed Kubernetes environment spanning off-the-shelf and custom hardware.
Designing and implementing system-level tests for integration and verification of the telescope.
Assisting science users to operate the telescope during the construction phase.
Developing control and/or data processing software for test environment and telescope components in Python.

Role particulars

Location and office arrangements: Perth (Kensington), Western Australia

Salary: AU$118K - AU$127K per annum plus up to 15.4% superannuation

Tenure & work schedule: Indefinite - Full-time (preferred). Flexible arrangements of part-time (0.8 FTE) may be considered.

Reference: 98389

As the successful candidate, you will bring:

Essential:

A bachelor's or master's degree relevant to Software Engineering, and/or equivalent work experience in a relevant field.
Demonstrated post-graduate work experience in Python development within a collaborative environment.
Demonstrated experience in developing and supporting distributed, multi-core data processing software running in Cloud, Scientific Computing or High-Performance Computing (HPC) platforms.
Experience in deploying and operating applications in a Linux environment.


Desirable:

Experience with Kubernetes or other container orchestration systems.
Experience in developing Scientific Computing Software.
Knowledge of real-time streaming or batch data processing pipelines.
An interest in Astronomy.


For full details about this role, please review the Position Description.

Setting you up for success

We are committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible to everyone. We recognise that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. Please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner via email (see details in the Position Description) and let us know how we can support you.

Eligibility

Applications for this position are open to Australian Citizens, New Zealand Citizens, and Australian Permanent Residents.

Appointment to this role is subject to provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements. Given the nature of the role, the successful candidate should also be able and willing to work flexible hours when required, and travel locally, nationally, and occasionally internationally as required for project needs.

Life at CSIRO and Flexible work arrangements

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. We can discuss flexible work arrangements with you during the recruitment process. CSIRO also offers a range of leave entitlements, benefits and career development opportunities. To find out more, visit Careers at CSIRO.

Inclusion and belonging

Solving Australia's greatest challenges takes a diversity of minds and lived experiences. We know diverse teams are more effective and deliver more innovative outcomes. As an equal employment opportunity organisation, we are committed to creating diverse and inclusive teams where people feel they belong. We recognise true diversity encompasses all ages, abilities, cultures, faiths, levels of education, genders, sexualities, diversity of thought and much more. We focus on hiring people who share our values of People First, Further Together, Making it Real and Trusted.

CSIRO holds Gold Status for the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQIA+ inclusion, and a Science in Australia Gender Equity Bronze Award.

Child safety

CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs. View our Child Safe Policy.

How to apply

Please apply online and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Please note that we strongly encourage you to respond to each of the selection criteria in detail, and attach it to your cover letter as ONE document.

Applications close

1 February 2026, 11:00pm AEDT

Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

The Role 

We’re looking for a Lead Data Scientist to lead a high-performing team building end-to-end, data-driven products that create tangible value for hirers and job seekers. In this role, you’ll guide the inference components of our AI/ML products that help SEEK understand the marketplace, and you’ll deliver insightful analysis to enable impactful decision-making across the business. You’ll develop the team’s technical capability and support their career growth while overseeing delivery and partnering closely with Product, Engineering, Strategy, and Commercial stakeholders. 

You’ll thrive in a collaborative, fast-moving environment where alignment, estimation, dependency management, and cross-functional communication are critical. You enjoy being hands-on with models and methods, and you value continuous learning—both for yourself and for your team. 

On any given day, you might assess and guide the development of statistically sound, pragmatic models; prototype and evaluate new approaches to address real business questions; articulate the value created and the risks involved; and refine strategic thinking in partnership with Product Managers, Strategy, Architecture, and Commercial teams. You may collaborate with a dedicated Experimentation team to design and interpret A/B tests, mentor and support other data scientists by validating the value, accuracy, and limitations of their outputs, and work with Engineering and Product specialists to build end-to-end AI/ML solutions. 

Your closest collaborators will include peers across the Data Science stream, stream leads who bring Data Science, Engineering, and Product perspectives to joint problem-solving, and squad leads who track how your team contributes across SEEK’s broader AI initiatives. 

Key Responsibilities 

You will develop a deep understanding of a niche business domain—such as pricing, market position, or ad performance—and the data available to SEEK, translating that understanding into stronger decision-making within your area of responsibility. You’ll help the team turn real business problems into actionable requirements, clearly framing the value and limitations of data-driven approaches and ensuring modelling work is grounded in its business context. 

As a people leader, you’ll coach and sponsor your team’s growth, set clear goals, plan across sprints, define OKRs, and contribute to roadmaps. You’ll champion appropriate ML methods, explaining benefits and trade-offs to audiences ranging from data scientists to colleagues in Engineering and Product, tailoring the level of detail to each stakeholder. You’ll also bring strong delivery management—balancing experimentation with reliability and scale. 

 

Qualifications

You have extensive (8+ years) commercial experience building and improving data-driven products, with deep, hands-on knowledge of machine learning algorithms and model performance tuning. 

You have acted as a conduit between Data Science and Product, Architecture, and Engineering, solving commercial problems. 

You have managed a small team of Data Scientists or delivered large and complex projects. 

You’re highly proficient with Python, SQL, and Spark for data extraction and processing, and comfortable working within modern software development environments and tooling such as Git, AWS, Databricks, and MLflow (or equivalents). 

You communicate clearly, influence effectively across functions, and operate confidently amid ambiguity. 

You’re fluent on the command line in a *nix environment and hold a postgraduate qualification in a quantitative discipline (for example, Physics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or Engineering). 

Additional Information

Permanent Perks
At SEEK we offer:

Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Job Title: Principal Architect – AI Experiences and Enablement
Ad Text:
Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

The Role

The Principal Architect – AI Experiences and Enablement is a senior architecture leader reporting to the Head of Architecture – Data and AI. You’ll define and evolve SEEK’s vision, designs and roadmaps for AI-enabled and agentic solutions, setting standards for how we design, build, deploy and monitor responsible, human‑centred AI at scale. You’ll partner across design, data science, architecture, engineering, analytics, product and business to turn ideas into secure, scalable experiences that deliver value for customers and SEEKers. A core focus is enabling productivity with the AI for SEEK team and empowering the wider business and technology community with clear guardrails, reusable patterns and guidance aligned to SEEK’s strategy.

The Team

Sitting within the Data and AI Architecture domain, this role operates centrally across Customer, Enterprise and Platform architecture to drive cohesive strategies and governance. The team provides specialist, cross‑functional leadership to ensure scalable, consistent outcomes across SEEK’s ecosystem. You’ll manage and mentor solution architects, align architecture, uplift capability and strengthen stakeholder engagement.

Key Responsibilities

Shape and uphold the enterprise architectural strategy and standards for AI experiences and agents - defining reference architectures and guardrails for creation, orchestration, monitoring, observability and oversight to ensure safety, reliability and accountability.
Continuously refine agentic strategy using signals from product, business, architecture and engineering to stay aligned with broader enterprise and domain architectures. Act as a strategic advisor to Technology and Senior Leadership on AI trends, risks and opportunities, and lead solution design for high‑impact engagements to ensure alignment with standards and strategy.
Enable teams through expert consulting, reusable capabilities, patterns and frameworks that accelerate delivery while managing risk; mentor and champion responsible adoption across the organisation.
Drive innovation by scanning and testing emerging frameworks, protocols and infrastructure patterns (e.g., MCP, A2A), engaging vendors, running timeboxed proofs of concept and translating learnings into updated standards, reference models and platform capabilities.
Embed trust, security, privacy and responsible AI through lifecycle practices that enable fast innovation without fragmentation or technical debt. Engage across the APAC ecosystem—partners, standards bodies and the broader community—to strengthen SEEK’s reputation and attract talent and partnerships.
Qualifications

Deep technical and architectural expertise across human‑in‑the‑loop systems, autonomous agents and backend workflow automation, grounded in AI/ML, LLMs, agent frameworks (e.g., LangChain, AutoGen, CrewAI) and cloud‑native design on AWS/GCP.

Proven ability to architect agentic systems balancing autonomy, explainability and human control, including context engineering, memory isolation, state management and event‑driven, modular patterns using vector databases and modern AI frameworks.

Hands‑on experience building and scaling AI platform capabilities (e.g., LLM gateways, MCP gateways/servers) and familiarity with interoperability standards/protocols such as MCP, A2A and AP2, or demonstrable ability to rapidly upskill.

Strong command of AI observability, monitoring and evaluation to ensure agent safety, transparency and performance, with practical tool and practice exposure.

Enterprise‑scale strategic advisory impact—shaping AI and agentic adoption, risk management, governance and investment decisions; influencing executives and senior stakeholders with clear, pragmatic recommendations.

Recognised leadership and influence—mentoring and upskilling engineers and architects, communicating complex AI concepts to technical and non‑technical audiences, and building communities of practice internally and across APAC.

Growth mindset with a track record of innovation and guiding organisations through significant technology change; comfortable with ambiguity and experimentation. Bonus: consulting experience, low‑code automation (e.g., n8n), major SaaS platforms (ServiceNow, Salesforce, Workday) and partner/community engagement across APAC.

Additional Information

Permanent Perks
At SEEK we offer:

Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do.

L3Harris Technologies is the Trusted Disruptor in the defense industry. With customers’ mission-critical needs always in mind, our employees deliver end-to-end technology solutions connecting the space, air, land, sea and cyber domains in the interest of national security.




About the role

L3Harris Communication Systems is a world leader in ground tactical and airborne mission communication solutions and a global provider of ground based C4 systems and transportable SATCOM terminals. We are focused on delivering advanced systems to meet the needs of our customers, uniting multiple forms of communication together, and covering communication over air, ground, sea, and space.

 Are you ready to advance your career in systems engineering? We’re offering an exciting opportunity for a Senior Specialist, Systems Engineering to join our team on the Mature Support Contract (MSC), supporting the sustainment of L3Harris Tactical Radio Products based at Hamilton.

In this role, you’ll play a key part in driving engineering change activities — from product modifications and enhancements to technical investigations, obsolescence management, and the responsible disposal of L3Harris and third-party products. You’ll also help ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory frameworks, contractual obligations, and customer requirements.

 

What the role will involve

Coordinate with all stakeholders — including suppliers and third-party engineering service providers — to ensure clear understanding of responsibilities, processes, and timeframes.

Lead engineering change activities for product modifications and enhancements, managing the full lifecycle from requirements definition to design, verification, and reporting.

Review and assess Technical Information Reviews (TIRs) that may impact the fit, form, or function of Products Being Supported (PBS) items, and provide expert advice or recommendations to the MSC Program Office as needed.

Conduct technical investigations into radio product issues, preparing detailed written analyses, recommendations, and resolutions.

Monitor and maintain PBS items throughout their lifecycle, identifying and addressing product or supportability issues, tracking change proposals, and managing product roadmaps.

Respond to Requests for Information (RFIs) from the MSC Program Office promptly, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

Contribute to Contract Status Reports by providing updates on performance, planned activities, issues, and opportunities related to the MSC.

Manage and update engineering-related plans, procedures, and documents, including Contract Data Requirement List (CDRL) deliverables.

Support the organization, coordination, and execution of engineering and technical operations across the MSC project.

 

What you’ll bring

The role requires the following experience and skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering recognized by Engineers Australia Examples include: Avionics, Electrical, Mechanical, Mechatronics, Systems, Software

Minimum of 6 years of engineering experience or equivalent experience.

Experience working in the Defence industry is a preference, though operating within a complex, large international business will also be considered

Experience in supporting small and large scale engineering projects

A background in sustainment will be highly regarded.

Ability to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance (AGSVA at the NV1 level.

Knowledge of HF, VHF, UHF and Narrowband SATCOM Systems

Experience with mobile networking within a tactical environment and tactical data messaging

Knowledge of secure voice and data systems including an understanding of cryptographic equipment

Experience with verification, especially test procedure development.




A few of our employee benefits are

An additional week of leave per annum plus the option to buy or sell up to 2 weeks additional annual leave.

Salary continuance insurance (SCI pays 75% of your base salary and bonus for up to 2 years)

Discounted private health insurance

Life & Total Permanent Disability Cover

Novated Car Leasing

Company supported professional development programs

Retail Reward programs




Important to know

Due to the nature of our work many our roles require an Australian citizenship and will require the successful candidate to successfully apply and hold an Australian Defence Security Clearance and/or be assessed to work with ITAR information.  Please answer the pre-screening questions upon applying for this assessment.

L3Harris respectfully requests no agency submissions at this time.

As an equal opportunities employer, L3Harris is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

mathemaAI & ML Engineer



Full Time Opportunity 
 
We're looking for an experienced AI and Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of data-driven products.

The AI & ML Engineer plays a critical role in building data-driven products and analytical solutions that drives Greenstone's business outcomes. This role will particularly focus on developing and maintaining machine learning models and AI algorithms that power product features, enhance customer experiences, and optimise decision-making.

Working closely with product owners, data analysts/scientists, and wider business stakeholders, you will transform complex datasets into scalable AI/ML solutions, ensuring models are interpretable, reliable, and aligned with product and business goals.

What are we looking for? 




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning or a related field 
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with actuaries, analysts, and business stakeholders 
Minimum of 3 years of industry experience in Data Science or Machine Learning, with a proven track record of developing and deploying models for customer churn prediction, customer segmentation, and customer lifetime value estimation 
Proficiency in AI and ML frameworks and libraries such as scikit-learn and PyTorch; strong experience with data manipulation libraries including Pandas and NumPy 
Solid programming skills in Python and SQL, with the ability to analyse complex datasets and interpret analytical findings effectively 
Strong understanding of Generative AI concepts and techniques, including large language models (LLMs) and prompt engineering; hands-on experience with libraries such as Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) frameworks 
Experience in model versioning, monitoring, and implementing automated retraining pipelines. Experience with MLflow or similar model lifecycle management tools 
Experience working with code repositories (GitHub)
Ability to balance technical excellence with practical business considerations, particularly within regulated industry environments

 

Desirable: 




Hands-on experience with Databricks and Cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google
Understanding of insurance data and domain knowledge such as policies, claims and underwriting




Our Promise to Our People

We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That's why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:

Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more

State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company café (weekly free lunch) & on-site gym
Health & well-being initiatives and programs
Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops
Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people
Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, Zoo passes, live shows + more
Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks)


Who We Are

Greenstone distributes insurance products under trusted brands in Australia, New Zealand and Canada. Some of our brands are Buddy, Australian Seniors, New Zealand Seniors, OneChoice, Real Insurance, SPCA Pet Insurance, Prime Pet Insurance, North Cover, FiftyUp, Guardian and Choosi.

We are the leading distributor of direct Insurance products in the Australian insurance market. Since launching into the Financial Services sector in 2007, Greenstone has experienced a commanding volume of growth being recognised for our credible brands, customer focused values and people-driven work culture.

We are passionate about our core values, which contribute towards the positive culture that supports our employees, our customers and our community.

Location

Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Norwest, only a short walk from Norwest Metro station and also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown.

About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


Combat Systems Engineer Opportunities – Growing Our Maritime Engineering Team

As we expand our Maritime portfolio, we’re seeking multiple Combat Systems Engineers to join our growing team supporting multiple initiatives across Land, Surface, Subsurface, Air and Space domains. These roles contribute directly to the design, integration and delivery of advanced combat systems for the Australian Defence Force. 


About the Opportunities:

As part of our expanding Combat Systems Engineering team, you will contribute to systems engineering activities across the full lifecycle. Working within multidisciplinary teams, you will help shape mission-critical capabilities and ensure the successful delivery of complex naval systems.

You will:

Contribute to Combat System engineering activities including requirements analysis, architecture definition, subsystem development and preparation for integration and verification.

Support the hands-on management, development and refinement of Combat System architectures.

Develop, maintain and update functional and non-functional requirements, system models and design artefacts.

Support planning, development and execution of Verification activities and associated documentation.

Prepare for major program milestones including design reviews, test readiness reviews and system readiness reviews.

Develop and progress Engineering Changes through the engineering lifecycle.

Provide technical expertise and mentor junior engineers as needed.

Collaborate closely with specialty disciplines (Safety, Human Factors, Cyber, Topside, ILS) to ensure design assurance and holistic system compliance.

 

About You:

You’re a skilled Systems Engineer ready to contribute to high-profile Defence programs. You enjoy solving complex problems, collaborating in multidisciplinary environments, and driving engineering outcomes that make a real impact.

You bring:

Extensive experience across the systems engineering lifecycle, using structured methods, tools (including DOORS) and disciplined processes.

Strong background in the design and development of military systems incorporating GFX and COTS components.

Significant experience integrating, testing and evaluating Combat System products on naval platforms or similarly complex systems.

Experience working in a multi-disciplinary engineering environment, ideally within Defence.

Ability to engage effectively with internal stakeholders and external partners to achieve shared outcomes.

Deep expertise in relevant combat system technologies and domains.

Experience applying engineering development methodologies to complex systems.

Knowledge of key C4ISREW or warfare domains (AAW, ASW, ASuW) is highly regarded.




Why Join Us:
Gain unparalleled, hands-on proficiency through LMA’s comprehensive learning framework, which blends reach-back access to Lockheed Martin expertise with immersive training in Combat System Management and Integrated Weapon Systems. You’ll learn directly from local, multi-domain combat system integration specialists, benefiting from their real-world insights while developing a self-directed, “learn by doing” mindset.

You’ll also have access to LMA’s extensive online technical library, including curated instructional courseware, the Engineering Storefront for on-demand learning modules, pre-recorded webinars, and active participation in LMA’s electronic forums. Together, these resources are designed to help you deepen your knowledge, solve complex integration challenges, and stay well ahead-of-ready in the naval surface combatant domain.


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:
