About us

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the role

As our naval combat systems capability continues to grow, we’re seeking an experienced Capability Development & Sustainment Engineer to help shape the future of Australia’s AEGIS Combat System.

This role plays a key part in defining long-term development pathways, sustainment strategies and upgrade planning across the RAN’s AEGIS-equipped fleet.

You’ll combine systems engineering expertise with strategic insight to influence capability decisions, guide through-life support, and deliver a 5–10-year roadmap that keeps AEGIS effective, modern and mission-ready.

In this customer-facing, collaborative role, you will:

Lead capability evolution, upgrades, and sustainment planning for the AEGIS Combat System

Develop long-term capability roadmaps using evidence-based, risk-informed assessments

Partner with the Destroyer Enterprise and Defence stakeholders to align plans with operational priorities

Facilitate capability workshops, reviews, and customer discussions on future system direction

Support system architecture updates, obsolescence management and engineering change proposals (ECPs)

Provide systems engineering guidance across the lifecycle to ensure cohesive, future-proof outcomes

 

About you

You’re a seasoned Systems Engineer or Capability Planner with strong Defence domain experience. You enjoy forward planning, influencing technical direction, and working with stakeholders to drive capability outcomes.

You bring:

Extensive experience across systems engineering, capability planning or sustainment

Proven ability to develop or contribute to long-term capability or technical strategies

Knowledge of system architecture, lifecycle management, obsolescence, and change control

Strong communication skills and confidence engaging with Defence stakeholders

Experience in Defence acquisition or sustainment—ideal for former ADF or enterprise-level planners

Engineering degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronics, Aerospace, or similar

NV1 security clearance and ability to access Export Controlled information

Why join us

At Lockheed Martin, you’ll help shape the future of Australia’s naval combat capability, working alongside leading engineers and Defence specialists. You’ll be trusted to think long term, balancing innovation, sustainment and mission readiness across the full system lifecycle.

How we reward and support you

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs

The Company

Our client is a high-growth, tech-led business at an exciting point in their AI journey. With strong foundations and governance already in place, they're now looking for an AI Engineer who can genuinely influence how AI is applied across the business - from streamlining processes to improving decision-making and creating real, measurable value. If you have hands-on experience across AI/ML, Generative AI, Agentic AI, or Data Science, we'd love to hear from you.

The Role

In this dynamic role, you'll face new challenges every day, applying a strong process-driven mindset while continuously looking for smarter, more innovative ways to improve how things are done. As part of a newly formed team, you'll play a key role in driving innovation - experimenting with and operationalising AI solutions for unique, business-aligned use cases. You'll also own the end-to-end lifecycle of AI systems, algorithms, and machine learning models.

Your Skills & Experience

Bachelor's/master's in computer science, Data Science, Engineering or equivalent experience.
5+ years in deploying Machine Learning & AI Based solutions
Strong programming skills in Python or another relevant scripting language, alongside AI/ML Frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Demonstrated delivery of at least one generative-AI or machine learning solution in production
Understanding Machine Learning model and Evaluation metrics, and how to operationalise them to continually monitor models
Experience working with multimodal models, and long context is desirable, designing robust AI solutions, that can work with production scale data.
Working with models to optimise, fine tune and enhance their performance, while working in the dimensions of cost and scalability.

Desirable Experience:

Experience with workflow management tools such as n8n, copilot studio flows or Zapier
Experience with Agentic frameworks and protocols e.g. A2A, Microsoft Agent Framework, LangGraph, MCP
Cloud architecture and containerisation skillsets
Frontend or integration experience


About You

You have exceptional technical know-how and a real passion for the end-to-end solutions that drive the user experience and customer happiness. You will have effective written and oral communication skills for use in a complex project environment.

What's on offer?

A true career opportunity with a rapidly growing company.
Extensive opportunities to grow your skill set and enjoy career growth.
The camaraderie of an energetic, highly talented team of innovators.
A company that rewards perfection and champion work-life balance.

*Multiple Roles Available*

We're partnering exclusively with a purpose-driven, product-led SaaS start-up that applies machine learning to solve meaningful, real-world problems at scale. Their platform supports organisations globally by turning complex data into actionable insights, enabling smarter decision-making and measurable outcomes.

Machine Learning here isn’t experimental or theoretical - it’s deeply embedded in the product. Models are deployed, monitored, iterated on, and directly influence how customers operate day to day. 

Location - Sydney | Hybrid (1 day in office/week)
Salary - Up to $150k Base + Super + ESOP (dependent on experience)

What You’ll Do:

Build, train, deploy, and maintain machine learning models used in live production systems.
Work across data preparation, feature development, modelling, and inference.
Improve model performance through experimentation, evaluation, and iteration.
Operate and support ML pipelines, including monitoring, debugging, and optimisation.
Partner with engineers and product stakeholders to integrate ML outputs into customer-facing features.
What You'll Bring:

Experience delivering applied machine learning in real-world, production environments.
Strong Python skills with an engineering-first approach and focus on maintainable code.
Solid SQL and experience working with large, imperfect datasets.
Understanding of backend systems, data modelling, and production software practices.
Ability to reason about data quality, statistical trade-offs, and modelling decisions.
Degree in a technical or quantitative discipline, or equivalent professional experience.
Exposure to modern cloud-based data or ML workflows is helpful but not required.

Company description:



CAPGEMINI SERVICE SAS



Job description:

Your Role

As the Splunk Monitoring Specialist, you will ensure proactive monitoring of IT infrastructure and applications using Splunk ITSI. The role includes validating automated tickets, performing manual interventions, analyzing alerts, maintaining SLA compliance, and supporting continuous improvement initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:
Monitor service health and KPIs in Splunk ITSI - proactively detect infrastructure and application issues.
Respond to alerts and incidents within SLA - perform triage and correlation analysis in ITSI.
Validate and manage ServiceNow tickets - create manual tickets when auto-creation fails.
Analyze alerts in ITSI - identify false positives and tune KPIs and thresholds.
Perform daily health checks - provide alert summaries, SLA compliance, and trend reports.
Update monitoring configurations, correlation searches, and maintain change logs.
Create and maintain SOPs, runbooks, dashboards, and response manuals for ITSI and ServiceNow.
Recommend improvements for alert tuning, automation, and continuous service optimization.

Your Experience

Strong expertise in Splunk ITSI for service health monitoring, KPI creation, and alert correlation.
Advanced ServiceNow Reporting & Performance Analytics skills, including dashboard creation and data visualization.
Solid understanding of ITIL processes (Incident, Change, SRM) and SIAM framework.
Hands-on experience with SLM process, SLA calculations, and ServiceNow ticket creation with alert analysis.
Proven problem-solving ability
Self-managing and a self-starter
Uses initiative and able to address any issues

Preferred Certifications:

Splunk Core Certified Power User
Splunk ITSI Certified
ITIL Foundation

Apply today!

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.
